column4: hello, I have added this ppa: https://launchpad.net/~intuitivenipple/+archive/ppa but I can't seem to do apt-get install r5u870-dkms (one of the packages there)
Are you sure that this package is available for your Ubuntu version?
i actually dont know much of what I'm doing, the drivers of my laptop's webcam are supposedly in this PPA.
I see, did you check Ubuntu's "restricted drivers" tool?
where can I find that? upon refreshing laptop I remmeber this worked last time but I was using an older version
Eh, I'm honestly not sure, which Ubuntu version are you running?
the latest I think. whats that command again to find out?
That'd be "lsb_release -sc"
Well, then it's under System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers
the window just says No proprietary drivers are in use on this ysstem
I see, hm, well.
nothing for me to reset
I assume you have verified your camera ain't working with the standard software set?
yes cheese, xawtv both dont work
I see, well, honestly, no idea >.<
its fine. would you have any idea why I am not able to get the r5u870-dkms package from https://launchpad.net/~intuitivenipple/+archive/ppa?
There is no such package for your Ubuntu version in this PPA.
oh crap, then updating to lucid was bad :|
Probably you should find another PPA, this one seems to be rather old
would you happen to know a workaround for me to at least get to that r5u870-dkms folder? I saw a few commands that might work
Sorry, I'm not going to help you break your system by installing a package from another Ubuntu version.
